head.supplied: ¶ No provision has been made for digging the ground after planting and sowing it with grass. The fencing around the plantations as required by His Excellency has not been taken in account, portions o...

div.p: P67/10542, unit 631, VPRS 44 inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

This is a continuation of the previous letter, but note 10/8/67 later.
Add to 67-08-09a?
No provision has been made for digging the ground after planting and sowing it with grass. The fencing around the plantations as required by His Excellency has not been taken in account, portions of it will be available from other portions in the ground.
Nothing has been calculated for removal of Trees and lopping off branches so as to open up the vista to the Yarra and to Melbourne
For the purchase of the necessary Tools Wheel Barrows &c an additional sum of £15 will be required.
By the sale of the above after the work is completed part of this outlay might be refunded.
of expenditure for forming plantations and gravelling walks and carriage drive at Toorack Submitted to the honorable the President of the Board of Land & Works 10/8/67

cell.p: Raising and screening 562 loads (3/4 yd per load) of gravel (1 man to raise 5 loads pr day)

cell.p: Carting 562 loads gravel (8 loads pr day)

cell.p:
Wheeling gravel to garden walks, 127 yards 1 man 21 days at 6/.
See also M to D. Gillies, 29 June 1868.
